content: all in one cat - amigurumi pattern by criss wall i have a huge collection of scrap balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them these are my new favourites for raock gifts i know that there are a few lovely cat patterns out there already but some of them take quite a while to finish i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take around 30 mins to complete and do not involve sewing additional parts onto the work after you are finished stitches  chain chain  slip_stitch slip_stitch  single_crochet single_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  blo work in the back loop stitch only  puff - puff for the paws a normal puff where you draw up a loop/pull through a loop 4 times before yarning over and pulling through all 9 stitches don t chain 1 to close the puff notes  you can use any yarn and hook of your choice i just use the smallest hook i can to keep the holes small as a guide i usually use 3 5mm for dk/8ply and 4mm for aran/10ply  using 8ply the size is 7cm x 4cm  i use 8-9mm safety eyes either black or coloured a needle stuffing & scissors etc  it takes me approx 20 minutes to complete one cat  i use about 13 metres 14 yards of 8ply yarn for each criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-kitty-cat all in one cat instructions you can change colours in the cat as you please you can have a striped body change the face colour ear colour tail colour etc let your imagination run wild… row 1 single_crochet 6 into a magic_ring 6 stitches row 2 *increase in each single_crochet* repeat around 12 stitches row 3 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 18 stitches row 4 we complete the tail and the paws see note above in this row slip_stitch into the first stitch chain 22 single_crochet back up the chain to the beginning and slip_stitch into the same stitch where the tail started tail made blo single_crochet 6 blo 1 puff first paw blo single_crochet 2 blo 1 puff second paw blo single_crochet 7 18 stitches push on the inside of the puff stitches so they puff out to the outside of the work summary of row 4 tail single_crochet 6 paw single_crochet 2 paw single_crochet 7 = 18 stitches row 5 single_crochet 5 the next stitch just secures the tail to the side of the body so it curls around for the sixth single_crochet stitch pick up one loop of the tail on your hook first and then complete the single_crochet like normal working through the body stitch and the one loop from the tail single_crochet 12 18 stitches row
